Class PackageValidator

java.lang.Object
info.oais.oaisif.packagevalidator.PackageValidator
public class PackageValidator extends Object
Validator for OAIS-IF Information Package JSON files. This class provides validation according to the OAIS-IF Information Package schema using the org.json library for JSON parsing rather than standard JSON Schema validation.

  • Constructor Details

    • PackageValidator

      public PackageValidator()

  • Method Details

    • validateFile

      public boolean validateFile(String filePath) throws IOException, org.json.JSONException
      Validates a JSON file against the OAIS Information Package schema.
      Parameters:
      filePath - the path to the JSON file to validate
      Returns:
      true if the file is valid, false otherwise
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error reading the file
      org.json.JSONException - if there is an error parsing the JSON

    • validateRoot

      private void validateRoot(org.json.JSONObject json)
      Validates the root of the JSON object.
      Parameters:
      json - the JSON object to validate

    • validateInformationPackage

      private void validateInformationPackage(org.json.JSONObject ip, String path)
      Validates the InformationPackage object. Checks that the InformationPackage object has the required properties and that the version field is in the correct format. The required properties are: "InformationObject", "IsDeclaredComplete", "PackageDescription", "PackageType", "version" version must be of the form d.d.d where d is a digit
      Parameters:
      ip - the InformationPackage JSON object
      path - the JSON path to the InformationPackage object

    • validateEnum

      void validateEnum(String value, String[] validValues, String fieldName, String path)
      Validates that a value is one of the valid values for a field.
      Parameters:
      value - the value to validate
      validValues - the array of valid values
      fieldName - the name of the field
      path - the JSON path to the field

    • validateInformationObject

      private void validateInformationObject(org.json.JSONObject io, String path)
      Validates the InformationObject object. The InformationObject object must have either DataObject and RepresentationInformation or Reference. It cannot have both DataObject and RepresentationInformation and Reference.
      Parameters:
      io - the InformationObject JSON object
      path - the JSON path to the InformationObject object

    • validateDataObject

      private void validateDataObject(org.json.JSONObject dataObj, String path)
      Validates the DataObject object. The DataObject object must have either EncodedObject or IdentifierObject. It cannot have both EncodedObject and IdentifierObject. The size property must be a non-negative integer as a string.
      Parameters:
      dataObj - the DataObject JSON object
      path - the JSON path to the DataObject object

    • validateEncodedObject

      private void validateEncodedObject(org.json.JSONObject encodedObj, String path)
      Validates the EncodedObject object. The EncodedObject object must have an Encoding property and an EncodedContent property. If the Encoding property is "OTHER", the EncodedObject must have a CustomEncoding property.
      Parameters:
      encodedObj - the EncodedObject JSON object
      path - the JSON path to the EncodedObject object

    • validateIdentifierObject

      private void validateIdentifierObject(org.json.JSONObject idObj, String path)
      Validates the IdentifierObject object. The IdentifierObject object must have an IdentifierString and an IdentifierType property. If the IdentifierType property is "OTHER", the IdentifierObject must have a CustomIdentifierType property. If the object has a version property, it must be of the form d.d.d where d is a digit. If the object has a Description property, it cannot be empty. If the object has a ReferenceType property, it must be one of the valid reference types.
      Parameters:
      idObj - the IdentifierObject JSON object
      path - the JSON path to the IdentifierObject object

    • validateRepresentationInformation

      private void validateRepresentationInformation(org.json.JSONObject repInfo, String path)
      Validates the RepresentationInformation object. The RepresentationInformation object must have a RepInfoID and a RepInfoCategory property. The RepInfoCategory property must match the regular expression pattern. The object must have one of AndGroup, OrGroup, InformationObject, or RecursionHalt.
      Parameters:
      repInfo - the RepresentationInformation JSON object
      path - the JSON path to the RepresentationInformation object

    • validateAndGroup

      private void validateAndGroup(org.json.JSONArray andGroup, String path)
      Validates the AndGroup array. The AndGroup array must contain at least one element. Each element in the array must be a RepresentationInformation object.
      Parameters:
      andGroup - the AndGroup JSON array
      path - the JSON path to the AndGroup array

    • validateOrGroup

      private void validateOrGroup(org.json.JSONArray orGroup, String path)
      Validates the OrGroup array. The OrGroup array must contain at least one element. Each element in the array must be a RepresentationInformation object.
      Parameters:
      orGroup - the OrGroup JSON array
      path - the JSON path to the OrGroup array

    • getErrors

      public List<PackageValidator.ValidationError> getErrors()
      Getter for the list of validation errors.
      Returns:
      list of errors

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Main method to run the validator.
      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments, expects the path to the JSON file to validate
